messageBody:
Has anyone had the following problem with XMLUnit?

I'm trying to parse XHTML 1.0 and XMLUnit's XPath asserts are not
working at all. If I walk the DOM tree, all is well; however if I use
assertXpathExists()/SimpleXpathEngine, it's no good.

I have enclosed the test and my results. If anyone can shed some light,
that'd be great. Thanks!

--------------------------------------------------
package ca.bluejays.learning.test;

import junit.framework.*;

import org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl;
import org.apache.xerces.jaxp.*;
import org.custommonkey.xmlunit.*;
import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;

public class XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest extends XMLTestCase {
private String xhtmlDocumentContent;

public XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(String testName,
String xhtmlDocumentContent) {

setName(testName);
this.xhtmlDocumentContent = xhtmlDocumentContent;
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("XHTML/XPath Engine Learning
Tests");

String strictXhtmlDocument = "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<!DOCTYPE html \r\n"
+ " PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN\"\r\n"
+ "
\"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd\">\r\n"
+ "<html xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"
xml:lang=\"en\" lang=\"en\">\r\n"
+ "</html>\r\n";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"strict XHTML document", strictXhtmlDocument));

String noDoctypeXhtmlDocument = "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<html xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"
xml:lang=\"en\" lang=\"en\">\r\n"
+ "</html>\r\n";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"no doctype XHTML document", noDoctypeXhtmlDocument));

String simplerXmlNamespaceXhtmlDocument = "<?xml
version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<html xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\">\r\n"
+ "</html>\r\n";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"simpler XML namespace XHTML document",
simplerXmlNamespaceXhtmlDocument));

String simplestPossibleXhtmlDocument = "<?xml
version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<html />";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"simplest possible XHTML document",
simplestPossibleXhtmlDocument));

String openCloseHtmlXhtmlDocument = "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<html>\r\n" + "</html>";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"open/close <html>", openCloseHtmlXhtmlDocument));

String openCloseHtmlWithDoctypeXhtmlDocument = "<?xml
version=\"1.0\"?>\r\n"
+ "<!DOCTYPE html \r\n"
+ " PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN\"\r\n"
+ "
\"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd\">\r\n"
+ "<html>\r\n" + "</html>";
suite.addTest(new XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest(
"open/close <html> with doctype",
openCloseHtmlWithDoctypeXhtmlDocument));

return suite;
}

protected void runTest() throws Exception {
XMLUnit.setIgnoreWhitespace(true);
XMLUnit.setTestParser(DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.class
.getName());
XMLUnit.setTransformerFactory(TransformerFactoryImpl.class
.getName());
XMLUnit.setSAXParserFactory(SAXParserFactoryImpl.class
.getName());

SimpleXpathEngine engine = new SimpleXpathEngine();
NodeList nodeList = engine.getMatchingNodes("/html", XMLUnit
.buildTestDocument(xhtmlDocumentContent));

assertEquals(1, nodeList.getLength());
}
}
--------------------------------------------------
Failure list. Means none of these tests find "/html" in the document.

strict XHTML document
(ca.bluejays.learning.test.XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest)

no doctype XHTML document
(ca.bluejays.learning.test.XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest)

simpler XML namespace XHTML document
(ca.bluejays.learning.test.XmlUnitXpathEngineLearningTest)

open/close <html> with doctype
